rating_overall.Name: rating_overall
rating_overall.Specification:
Using the value from the attribute 'overall\_score', determine a rating.

\[9-10]: exceptional
[8-9): very high
[7-8): high
[6-7): average
under 6: poor

skills_df.Description:
Be exhaustive. List all the technical and professional skills. Use the resume/ interview evaluations/ code evaluations. Provide information on the source for the information.
LABELS AND SCORES
==================
Use labels to describe the quality of the information. 
-- verified: (if the evaluation was performed on the basis of a code base evaluation or was validated in an interview evaluation). score:10
-- verifiable: if there's a URL or certificate id present and the certificate in itself demonstrates the skill. score: 10Â 
-- detailed: (if referenced in the context of a role or project). score: 7
-- listed: if the skill is part of a list but for which there is no context. score:5

note: Only include an item in source IF we actually have content originating from that source.
skills_df.Name: skills_df
skills_df.embedded_schema:
skill: text
type: text
labels: list of text
score: integer
source: text
source: text
skills_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes:
-- skill:
-- type: technical, professional, language, artistic, etc
-- labels:
-- score:
-- source:
source\_details:

degrees_df.Name: degrees_df
degrees_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Attributes
-- degree: of(AA, BA, AB, MA, MS, PhD, etc)
-- major:
-- institution
-- year\_of\_graduation:

residence_state.Description: United States state as can be determined by residence address, telephone  area code, or location of latest onsite employer; for example, Washington, California, New York
residence_state.Name: residence_state

has_scrum_master_exp.Description: Has held a scrum master role. To be eligible, person must have held a title with scrum master in the name.
has_scrum_master_exp.Name: has_scrum_master_exp

consulting_firm_experience_df.Description: Job experience acquired thru consulting assignments. Only include if work is done for recognized consulting firms.
consulting_firm_experience_df.Name: consulting_firm_experience_df
consulting_firm_experience_df.Specification: When the candidate resume includes work at a consulting firm, take into account the roles within that consulting firm to capture those company experiences. The term "consult" is required in order for it to be considered consulting work. Answer: "Yes" or No" and provide a summary.

skill_opportunities_for_improvement_df.Description:
Given the person's experience and skills, what five areas exist for personal and professional development that would make the person a better practitioner? If their toolset is dated, what newer tools and technologies make sense for their areas of practice?

We're looking for suggestions to enhance obvious gaps in their tool set.

For example:
-- If the person has only one programming language, they could learn another one.
--  If the person knows only relational database, they could learn a document database or a graph database.
skill_opportunities_for_improvement_df.Name: skill_opportunities_for_improvement_df
skill_opportunities_for_improvement_df.embedded_schema:
-- area_for_improvement: Text
-- recommendation: Text
-- level_of_effort_required:Integer (1-10)
-- benefit from improvement: Text

attribute_name: Textinit_rating:Integer
init_eval:Text
revised_possible_rating:Integer
revised_possible_eval:Text
skill_opportunities_for_improvement_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes:
-- area\_for\_improvement:
-- recommendation:
-- level\_of\_effort\_required:
-- benefit\_from\_improvement:
-- attributes\_affected: {
attribute\_name:
init\_rating:
init\_eval:
revised\_possible\_rating:
revised\_possible\_eval:
}

social_media_github.Description: Github profile URL as can be determined from available resources
social_media_github.Name: social_media_github

opportunities_for_improvement_df.Description: Given the person's experience and skills, what five areas of professional improvement exist that would make the person a better candidate for roles where they're qualified. We're not looking for crazy stretch goals; just the application of effort to bridge gaps and get the person on track for career growth. For example: Add achievements,Learn another programming language, get certification in more relevant and desirable technology, Get re-certified for an expired certificate
opportunities_for_improvement_df.Name: opportunities_for_improvement_df
opportunities_for_improvement_df.embedded_schema:
-- area_for_improvement: Text
-- recommendation: Text
-- level_of_effort_required:Integer (1-10)
-- benefit from improvement

attribute_name: Textinit_rating:Integer
init_eval:Text
revised_possible_rating:Integer
revised_possible_eval:Text
opportunities_for_improvement_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes:
-- area\_for\_improvement:
-- recommendation:
-- level\_of\_effort\_required:
-- benefit\_from\_improvement:
-- attributes\_affected: {
attribute\_name:
init\_rating:
init\_eval:
revised\_possible\_rating:
revised\_possible\_eval:
}

strategic_impact_df.Description: Work history strategic impacts; for example: transitioned company to first position in Cloud Computing. These are outsized accomplishments, taking credit for very large  wins. Only look at past 7 years. Do not include work that could be taken as routine for the role.
strategic_impact_df.Name: strategic_impact_df
strategic_impact_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes:
-- achievement:
-- job title:
-- employer:
-- client:

has_fullstack_webdev_exp.Description: Does candidate have web development fullstack experience? Fullstack means that someone has the ability to use not just a web programming language but also has the ability to create APIs, work with a variety of database types, document and relational, for example; has experience with a web development framework, and has experience with a backend framework, such as node.js or Java Spring.
has_fullstack_webdev_exp.Name: has_fullstack_webdev_exp

is_resume_right_length.Description: Evaluate resume for length. We don't want it to be too short or too long. Include resume length in eval field.
is_resume_right_length.Name: is_resume_right_length
is_resume_right_length.Specification: Set to False if resume is less than 500 word or is more than 3000 words. Else set to True.

rating_quality_of_work_roles.Description: Look at titles and roles. More senior roles, prestige roles have more value.
rating_quality_of_work_roles.Name: rating_quality_of_work_roles
rating_quality_of_work_roles.Specification: Use a scale 0 - 10 to provide an aggregate evaluation the quality of all the candidate's work roles for the past 7 years.

has_linkedin.Description: Shows professionalism. A resume in the modern day must have a LinkedIn link. The presence of a LinkedIn profile in the resume allows us to look up their profile and see that it closely matches the resume.
has_linkedin.Name: has_linkedin

residence_country.Description: Country name as can be determined by residence address, phone area code, or location of latest onsite employer; for example, United States, Canada, Mexico
residence_country.Name: residence_country

quality_of_educational_institutions_df.Description: Evaluates reputation and latest rank of the higher education schools, only include educational institutions where the applicant received an undergraduate, graduate, or doctorate level degree; do not include institutions where applicant received a certificate or did not graduate. Use a scale 0-10, 0 for no higher education. 10 being most prestigious. Use latest, most accepted, authoritative data available when evaluating the institutions. Use 0 for no higher education.
quality_of_educational_institutions_df.Name: quality_of_educational_institutions_df
quality_of_educational_institutions_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Attributes:
institute\_name:
value: rating
eval:

dark_materials_reasons_no_eval_df.Description:
Hiring managers are capable of discrimination. What common discriminatory reasons should we be looking out for? For example; too young, too old, military service, sexual orientation, any attributes that could disqualify someone based on pre conceived notions.

Further examples: 
Ethnicity-based discrimination -- which could lead to ethnic stereotyping or bias.
Education elitism -- might lead to positive bias or overshadow other qualifications
Overqualification bias -- might lead some hiring managers to consider them overqualified for certain positions
Gender bias -- which could lead to gender-based assumptions or biases in male-dominated tech fields.
Halo/Horn effect: Allowing one positive or negative trait to influence overall perception of a candidate.
Name bias: Making assumptions based on a candidate's name, which can intersect with ethnic and gender biases.
Appearance bias: Judging candidates based on physical appearance, grooming, or style of dress rather than qualifications.
dark_materials_reasons_no_eval_df.Name: dark_materials_reasons_no_eval_df
dark_materials_reasons_no_eval_df.Specification:
List of 5 dictionaries, sorted by most insidious. Dictionary attributes:
-- negative: Potential bias that could be demonstrated by a hiring manager?
-- eval: Describe this bias
-- rating:In a scale of 1-10, how significant of a risk is this for the candidate to be considered?
-- remediation: How can we overcome this fault?

preferred_name.Description: The person's name as it appears in the resume.
preferred_name.Name: preferred_name

has_github.Description: Indicates level of seriousness about coding and IT project work in general.
has_github.Name: has_github
has_github.Specification: Identify if a candidate has a github account.

work_history_performance_metrics_df.Description: Work history achievements; for example, sales figures, project completion rates, money saved, etc. Only look at past 7 years.
work_history_performance_metrics_df.Name: work_history_performance_metrics_df
work_history_performance_metrics_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes
-- achievement: Quantified achievement
-- job title: Job title held associated with achievement
-- employer:
-- client:

has_data_analyst_exp.Description: Includes reporting, data analysis, business intelligence experience. Experience can be inferred from background that includes a set of multiple data analysts skills: SQL, Tableau, Power BI, Microstrategy, etc.
has_data_analyst_exp.Name: has_data_analyst_exp

rating_quality_of_work_experience.Description: Look at job accomplishments. Impact and high efforts should be highly regarded, as are examples of routine work expected of the role.
rating_quality_of_work_experience.Name: rating_quality_of_work_experience
rating_quality_of_work_experience.Specification: Rate the overall quality of all the candidate's work experience using a scale 0-10.

latest_employer.Name: latest_employer

Attributes:
-- employer
-- clients

-- job\_description
-- dates

_meta_cant_be_evaluated_df.Description: Stores a list of dictionaries of fields (Name) that cannot be evaluated
_meta_cant_be_evaluated_df.Name: _meta_cant_be_evaluated_df

resume_experience_negatives_df.Description: How is resume insufficient in terms of length, work experience details, achievements, etc
resume_experience_negatives_df.Name: resume_experience_negatives_df
resume_experience_negatives_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Attributes:
-- negative: What's the problem/issue?
-- eval: Explain why this is a significant fault 
-- rating:In a scale of 1-10, how significant of a fault is this?
-- remediation: How can we overcome this fault?

rating_overall_score.Name: rating_overall_score
rating_overall_score.Specification:
Using ratings and weights for attributes of Type 'Core', calculate an aggregate rating. Scale 0-10

Use decimal rating; for example, 9.8

rating_active_learning.Description: Rates certifications from the past 3 years, involvement in continuing education classes, personal projects, involvement in emerging technologies, etc. While active learning can take place within work, it's primarily meant to identify involvement in work that pushes the boundaries of the job title or role.
rating_active_learning.Name: rating_active_learning
rating_active_learning.Specification:
0 for no sign of active learning.

1-2 for slight sign of active learning; for example, indications that they are familiar with some newer technology or idea, but not actively pursuing it.

10 for extensive active learning; 10 for actively pursuing a degree beyond Bachelors. Active learning include personal projects, book learning,  publishing, earned certificates and degrees within the past 36 months, articles. If the resume refers to specific projects, presentations, articles, these are signs of active learning. Personal projects that exercise cloud or newer technologies, this is a sign of active learning.

residence_metro_area.Description: For example: Seattle, New York, Los Angeles. Use telephone area code, address in resume/other data sources
residence_metro_area.Name: residence_metro_area

pm_months_experience.Description: Months doing project management, including technical project management. Include all roles with 'project management' in the title
pm_months_experience.Name: pm_months_experience

pm_months_of_experience_rating.Name: pm_months_of_experience_rating
pm_months_of_experience_rating.Specification:
less than 1 year, 1
1-2, 2
2-3, 3
etc
10 or more years, 10

has_webdev_exp.Description: Has experience with web development? For example, with Typescript, Javascript, React, Angular, etc. This is someone that we can identify as being abale to develop a website
has_webdev_exp.Name: has_webdev_exp

has_non_american_university.Description: A non American university may lead to a bias from ignorance of the prestige of these universities

quality_of_educational_institutions.Description: Evaluates reputation and latest rank of the higher education schools, only include educational institutions where the applicant received an undergraduate, graduate, or doctorate level degree; do not include institutions where applicant received a certificate or did not graduate. Use a scale 0-10, 0 for no higher education. 10 being most prestigious. Use latest, most accepted, authoritative data available when evaluating the institutions. Use 0 for no higher education.
quality_of_educational_institutions.Name: quality_of_educational_institutions

has_technical_degree.Description: Has a Bachelor or greater degree in a technical field; for example, math, computer science, electrical engineering, etc

is_person_us_based.Description: Determine if possible if the person is not US based.
is_person_us_based.Name: is_person_us_based
is_person_us_based.Specification: Evaluate if possible whether the person is US based. Look at the phone number, indicators of where they were based. Evaluate the combination of direct employers, whether role was remote; language skills, etc. Provide a Yes or no answer.

rating_resume_communication_quality.Description: Evaluate the resume writing quality. Consider spelling and communication quality. The writer may have had to condense and use elision to fit content into a resume format so keep that in mind. Scale of 0-10
rating_resume_communication_quality.Name: rating_resume_communication_quality

email_address.Description: Email address as can be determined from available resources

has_consulting_exp.Description: Has this person worked in the role of a consultant?

skill_diversity.Description: Measure variety and volume of skills across multiple work related and valuable functions. Consider technical, interpersonal, and leadership domains. Also include knowledge of foreign languages.
skill_diversity.Name: skill_diversity
skill_diversity.Specification: Use a scale 0 - 10 to provide an aggregate measure of the candidate's variety and volume of skills

degree_class.Description: A rating representing the college degree earned by a person
degree_class.Name: degree_class
degree_class.Specification:
0 for no higher education
2-5 for certificates, depending on recognized level of difficulty and level from Associate to Professional (or something similar)
3 for AA
5 for BA
7 for Masters, 10 for PhD

communication_skills_df.Description: Communication skills demonstrated through formal writing, resume (take into account the quality and structure of the resume and how it compares relative to current professional standards), public presentations, etc. Provide an aggregate score.
communication_skills_df.Name: communication_skills_df
communication_skills_df.Specification:
Evaluate the candidate's communication skills as demonstrated through formal writing, resume (take into account the structure of the resume and how it compares relative to current professional standards), public presentations, etc.  Score each skill using a scale 1-10 and then provide an aggregate score summing up the candidate's communication skills overall and provide this aggregate score first in the value column
List of dictionaries. Ordered by highest impact. 
skill:
source:

role_experience_df.Description: By role type, number of months. Use a generic role name, instead of their job title. Examples of generic role names: Developer, Project Manager, Product Manager -- and not Sr. Project Manager, L2 Software Engineer, Staff Engineer, Assistant Product Manager.

List of dictionaries. Attributes:

technical_gaps_df.Description: For the role type in which the person has functioned, what technical and skill gaps exist that stand out? For example Candidate identifies as a data engineer but SQL is nowhere found in candidate evaluation material (resume, code, project, articles, etc)

List of dictionaries (max 5; sort by most serious fault). Attributes: 
-- gap\_type: for example, certificate, technology, skill
-- gap: eg, SQL
-- severity: 1-10 (10 being highest)
-- eval: eg, mentions data engineer but SQL not mentioned in resume

Only include educational institutions where the applicant received an undergraduate, graduate, or doctorate level degree; do not include institutions where applicant received a certificate or did not graduate. Use a scale 0-10, 0 for no higher education. 10 being most prestigious. Use latest, most accepted, authoritative data available when evaluating the institutions. Use 0 for no higher education.

value: rating
eval:

reasons_not_to_hire_df.Description: What are the top 5 reasons a hiring manager would have for not hiring this person? For example, lack of technical depth; poor written communication skills; overly broad set of skills -- no one can possibly know two dozen programming languages; lack of job experience. Include possible biases that may be obstacles to a hiring. These are not reasons for not hiring based on bias but rather reasons not to hire based on objective evaluations of the inputs.
reasons_not_to_hire_df.Name: reasons_not_to_hire_df
reasons_not_to_hire_df.Specification:
List of dictionaries. Dictionary attributes:
-- negative: What's the problem/issue?
-- eval: Explain why this is a significant fault for a hiring manager?
-- rating:In a scale of 1-10, how significant of a fault is this?
-- remediation: How can we overcome this fault?

rating_quality_of_employers.Name: rating_quality_of_employers
rating_quality_of_employers.Specification: Use a scale 0-10, where 10 for FAANG and similar level companies (highest paying/prestigious companies); lower scores for companies such as AT&T, T-Mobile, Microsoft, lower tier tech companies; 5 for known brands; 3 for lesser-known brands, 1 for small unknown. Aggregate all scores in a total value. More recent is weighted highest.

social_media_linkedin.Description: LinkedIn profile URL as can be determined from available resources
social_media_linkedin.Name: social_media_linkedin
